<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file defines the legacy PassManager class.  This class is used to hold,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// maintain, and optimize execution of Passes.  The PassManager class ensures</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that analysis results are available before a pass runs, and that Pass&#39;s are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// destroyed when the PassManager is destroyed.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add a pass to the queue of passes to run.  This passes ownership of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the Pass to the PassManager.  When the PassManager is destroyed, the pass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will be destroyed as well, so there is no need to delete the pass.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// may even destroy the pass right away if it is found to be redundant. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// implies that all passes MUST be allocated with &#39;new&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
